row.title: Gliosarcoma
row.field_page_description: Learn about gliosarcoma grades, features, causes, symptoms, who the tumors affect, how and where they form, and treatments.
row.field_feature_card_description: Gliosarcoma tumors are fast-growing tumors. They are commonly found along the surface of the brain from glial cells. Learn more about gliosarcoma tumors.
row.field_list_description: Gliosarcoma tumors are fast-growing tumors. They are commonly found along the surface of the brain from glial cells. Learn more about gliosarcoma tumors.

row.title: Be Our Partner
row.field_page_description: Learn how to partner with NCI-CONNECT to educate and engage brain and spine tumor patients and providers on clinical trials, and care and treatment advances.
row.field_feature_card_description: Learn how to partner with NCI-CONNECT to educate and engage brain and spine tumor patients and providers on clinical trials, and care and treatment advances.
row.field_list_description: Learn how to partner with NCI-CONNECT to educate and engage brain and spine tumor patients and providers on clinical trials, and care and treatment advances.
row.field_browser_title: Be Our Partner

row.title: In Treatment for a Rare Brain or Spine Tumor
row.field_page_description: Patients with a rare brain or spine tumor can learn about treatments, clinical trials, finding an expert doctor, and get guiding, support, and coping information.
row.field_feature_card_description: If you are starting treatment or are in treatment now, learn about your options, including clinical trials, how to find an expert doctor, and resources to help you cope and make treatment decisions.
row.field_list_description: If you are starting treatment or are in treatment now, learn about your options, including clinical trials, how to find an expert doctor, and resources to help you cope and make treatment decisions.
row.field_browser_title: In Treatment for a Rare Brain or Spine Tumor

row.title: Questions to Ask Your Doctor about Clinical Trials
row.field_short_title: Questions to Ask about Clinical Trials
row.field_page_description: Guiding questions for brain and spine tumor patients to ask their doctor about clinical trials or research studies.
row.field_feature_card_description: Your doctor can help you determine if a clinical trial is right for you.
row.field_list_description: Questions to ask your doctor to help you determine if a clinical trial is right for you.
row.field_browser_title: Questions to Ask about Clinical Trials - Rare Brain & Spine Tumor Network
row.field_card_title: Questions to Ask about Clinical Trials

row.title: Questions to Ask Your Doctor about Your Diagnosis
row.field_short_title: Questions to Ask about Your Diagnosis
row.field_page_description: Guiding questions for brain and spine tumor patients to ask their doctor about their diagnosis. This includes tumor type, location, size, grade, and other important features.
row.field_feature_card_description: Guiding questions for brain and spine tumor patients to ask their doctor about their diagnosis.
row.field_list_description: Questions to ask your doctor about your brain or spine tumor.
row.field_browser_title: Questions to Ask about Your Diagnosis - Rare Brain & Spine Tumor Network
row.field_card_title: Questions to Ask about Your Diagnosis

row.title: Questions to Ask Your Doctor about Support
row.field_page_description: Guiding questions for brain and spine tumor patients to ask their doctor about supportive care and coping resources.
row.field_feature_card_description: Your medical team can help you better understand your overall care, including supportive care and coping resources.
row.field_list_description: Questions to ask your doctor about your overall care and support.
row.field_browser_title: Questions to Ask About Support - Rare Brain & Spine Tumor Network

row.title: Related Organizations
row.field_page_description: Get links to brain and spine tumor organizations that provide support and help patients and their families connect with others.
row.field_feature_card_description: Get links to brain and spine tumor organizations that provide support and help patients and their families connect with others.
row.field_list_description: Get links to brain and spine tumor organizations that provide support and help patients and their families connect with others.
row.field_browser_title: Rare Brain and Spine Tumor Support Organizations

row.title: Outcomes and Risk Study for Patients with Rare Brain and Spine Tumors
row.field_page_description: Learn how to participate in an online survey to help improve care for patients with rare brain and spine tumors. The survey asks about symptoms, treatments, and life during and after cancer.
row.field_feature_card_description: Help us improve care for patients with rare CNS tumors by participating in an online survey. The survey will ask you questions about your symptoms, treatments, and quality of life during and after cancer.
row.field_list_description: Help us improve care for patients with rare CNS tumors by participating in an online survey. The survey will ask you questions about your symptoms, treatments, and quality of life during and after cancer.
row.field_browser_title: Rare Brain and Spine Tumors Outcomes and Risk Study

row.title: Finished with Rare Brain or Spine Tumor Treatment
row.field_page_description: Patients with a rare brain or spine tumor who have finished treatment can learn about follow-up care and get coping and support resources to help transition to a new post-cancer normal.
row.field_feature_card_description: If you have completed treatment, learn more about your follow-up care plan and resources to help you move into a new post-cancer normal.
row.field_list_description: If you have completed treatment, learn more about your follow-up care plan and resources to help you move into a new post-cancer normal.
row.field_browser_title: Finished with Rare Brain or Spine Tumor Treatment

row.title: Rare Brain and Spine Tumor Search Results
row.field_short_title: Rare Brain and Spine Tumor Search Results
row.field_page_description: Rare Brain and Spine Tumor search results.
row.field_browser_title: Rare Brain and Spine Tumor Search Results
row.field_card_title: Rare Brain and Spine Tumor Search Results

row.title: About Rare Brain and Spine Tumors
row.field_page_description: Learn about the doctors who treat brain and spine tumors, how most brain and spine tumors are diagnosed and graded, and more general information.
row.field_feature_card_description: Learn about the doctors who treat rare brain and spine tumors, how the tumors are diagnosed and graded, and get genetic information on CNS tumors.
row.field_list_description: Learn about rare brain and spine tumor grades, features, causes, symptoms, who the tumors affect, how and where they form, and treatments.
row.field_browser_title: About Rare Brain and Spine Tumors

row.title: Questions to Ask Your Neurosurgeon
row.field_page_description: Guiding questions to ask a neurosurgeon to help brain and spine tumor patients learn about the risks and benefits of surgery, the experience of the surgeon, and how to prepare for surgery.
row.field_feature_card_description: Your neurosurgeon can help you decide if surgery is the best treatment option for you, prepare for surgery, and make sure you’re receiving the best possible care.
row.field_list_description: Questions to ask your neurosurgeon to help you decide if surgery is the best treatment option for you, prepare for surgery, and make sure you’re receiving the best possible care.
row.field_browser_title: Questions to Ask Your Neurosurgeon - Rare Brain & Spine Tumor Network

row.title: Gliomatosis Cerebri
row.field_page_description: Learn about gliomatosis cerebri grades, features, causes, symptoms, who the tumors affect, how and where they form, and treatments.
row.field_feature_card_description: Gliomatosis cerebri tumors arise from glial cells in the brain. They often come back after treatment and are fast-growing. Learn more about gliomatis cerebri tumors.
row.field_list_description: Gliomatosis cerebri tumors arise from glial cells in the brain. They often come back after treatment and are fast-growing. Learn more about gliomatis cerebri tumors.
row.field_browser_title: Gliomatosis Cerebri

row.title: Pineal Region Tumors
row.field_page_description: Learn about pineal region tumor grades, features, causes, symptoms, who the tumors affect, how and where they form, and treatments.
row.field_feature_card_description: Pineal region tumors occur in the middle of the brain in the pineal region. They can spread to other areas in the central nervous system. Learn more about pineal region tumors.
row.field_list_description: Pineal region tumors occur in the middle of the brain in the pineal region. They can spread to other areas in the central nervous system. Learn more about pineal region tumors.
row.field_browser_title: Pineal Region Tumors

row.title: Diffuse Midline Gliomas
row.field_page_description: Learn about brainstem and diffuse midline gliomas grades, features, causes, symptoms, who they affect, how and where they form, and treatments.
row.field_feature_card_description: Diffuse midline gliomas are fast-growing tumors. They form in the brainstem, thalamus, spinal cord, and cerebellum. Learn more about brainstem and diffuse midline gliomas.
row.field_list_description: Diffuse midline gliomas are fast-growing tumors. They form in the brainstem, thalamus, spinal cord, and cerebellum. Learn more about brainstem and diffuse midline gliomas.
row.field_browser_title: Diffuse Midline Gliomas

row.title: When Your Rare Brain or Spine Tumor Recurs
row.field_page_description: Patients with a rare brain or spine tumor recurrence can learn about treatments, support resources, and get guiding questions to find a doctor and make care decisions.
row.field_feature_card_description: If your tumor has come back, learn about treatment options and resources to help support you.
row.field_list_description: If your tumor has come back, learn about treatment options and resources to help support you.
row.field_browser_title: When Your Rare Brain or Spine Tumor Recurs

row.title: Atypical Teratoid Rhabdoid Tumor (ATRT)
row.field_page_description: Learn about atypical teratoid rhabdoid tumor (ATRT) grades, features, causes, symptoms, who the tumors affect, how and where they form, and treatments.
row.field_feature_card_description: ATRTs are very rare, fast-growing tumors that often occur in the brain and spread to the spinal cord. They are caused by changes in a gene known as SMRCB1. Learn more about ATRTs.
row.field_list_description: ATRTs are very rare, fast-growing tumors that often occur in the brain and spread to the spinal cord. They are caused by changes in a gene known as SMRCB1. Learn more about ATRTs.
row.field_browser_title: Atypical Teratoid Rhabdoid Tumors (ATRT)

row.title: Choroid Plexus Tumors
row.field_page_description: Learn about choroid plexus tumor grades, features, causes, symptoms, who the tumors affect, how and where they form, and treatments.
row.field_feature_card_description: Choroid plexus tumors can be slow- or fast-growing tumors. They arise from a structure in the brain called the choroid plexus. Learn more about choroid plexus tumors.
row.field_list_description: Choroid plexus tumors can be slow- or fast-growing tumors. They arise from a structure in the brain called the choroid plexus. Learn more about choroid plexus tumors.
row.field_browser_title: Choroid Plexus Tumors

row.title: Meningioma
row.field_page_description: Learn about atypical and anaplastic meningioma grades, features, causes, symptoms, who the tumors affect, how and where they form, and treatments.
row.field_feature_card_description: Meningioma tumors are the most common type of primary brain tumor, but higher grade meningiomas are very rare, fast-growing tumors. Learn more about atypical and anaplastic meningiomas.
row.field_list_description: Meningioma tumors are the most common type of primary brain tumor, but higher grade meningiomas are very rare, fast-growing tumors. Learn more about atypical and anaplastic meningiomas.

row.title: Newly Diagnosed with a Rare Brain or Spine Tumor
row.field_page_description: Patients newly diagnosed with a rare brain or spine tumor can learn about symptoms, diagnosis, finding a doctor and guides and resources to make treatment and care decisions.
row.field_feature_card_description: If you just found out you have a brain or spine tumor, learn common symptoms, how your tumor type is diagnosed, how to find the right healthcare team and resources to guide your care decisions.
row.field_list_description: If you just found out you have a brain or spine tumor, learn common symptoms, how your tumor type is diagnosed, how to find the right healthcare team and resources to guide your care decisions.
row.field_browser_title: Newly Diagnosed with a Rare Brain or Spine Tumor

row.title: Partnerships
row.field_page_description: Learn about NCI-CONNECT partnerships to engage patients with rare brain and spine tumors and improve outcomes through awareness and education.
row.field_feature_card_description: NCI-CONNECT wants to partner with non-profit organizations to engage patients through awareness and education.
row.field_list_description: NCI-CONNECT wants to partner with non-profit organizations to engage patients through awareness and education.

row.title: Referrals
row.field_page_description: Find doctors and nurses with experience treating rare brain and spine tumors.
row.field_feature_card_description: Find doctors and nurses with experience treating rare CNS tumors.
row.field_list_description: Find doctors and nurses with experience treating rare CNS tumors.

row.title: About NCI-CONNECT
row.field_page_description: Learn about NCI-CONNECT and its aim to advance the understanding of rare adult brain and spine tumors through partnerships in clinical care, research, and education.
row.field_feature_card_description: Learn about NCI-CONNECT and its aim to advance the understanding of rare adult central nervous system cancers through partnerships in clinical care, research, and education.
row.field_list_description: Learn about NCI-CONNECT and its aim to advance the understanding of rare adult central nervous system cancers through partnerships in clinical care, research, and education.

row.field_card_title: About the Rare Brain & Spine Tumor Network

row.title: Questions to Ask Your Doctor about Their Experience
row.field_short_title: Questions to Ask Your Doctor about Their Experience
row.field_page_description: Guiding questions for brain and spine tumor patients to ask a doctor about his or her experience treating rare tumors.
row.field_feature_card_description: Different doctors have different experiences. These questions can help you decide if a doctor is the right one for you.
row.field_list_description: Questions to ask your doctor to help you decide if your doctor is the right one for you.
row.field_browser_title: Questions to Ask Your Doctor about Experience - Rare Brain & Spine Tumor Network
row.field_card_title: Questions to Ask Your Doctor about Their Experience

row.title: Questions to Ask Your Doctor about Your Treatment
row.field_short_title: Questions to Ask about Your Treatment
row.field_page_description: Guiding questions for brain and spine tumor patients to ask their doctor about treatment risks and benefits, side effects, managing treatment and resuming activities during treatment.
row.field_feature_card_description: Your doctor can help you understand your options and choose a treatment.
row.field_list_description: Questions to ask to help you decide on the best treatment for you.
row.field_browser_title: Questions to Ask About Treatment - Rare Brain & Spine Tumor Network
row.field_card_title: Questions to Ask about Your Treatment

row.title: Questions to Ask Your Doctor When Treatment Ends
row.field_short_title: Questions to Ask When Treatment Ends
row.field_page_description: Guiding questions for brain and spine tumor patients to ask their doctor after treatment finishes.
row.field_feature_card_description: Your doctor can help you understand what to expect once your treatment finishes.
row.field_list_description: Questions to ask your doctor once your treatment ends to help you know what to expect.
row.field_browser_title: Questions to Ask When Treatment Ends - Rare Brain & Spine Tumor Network
row.field_card_title: Questions to Ask When Treatment Ends

row.title: Medulloblastoma
row.field_page_description: Learn about malignant medulloblastoma grades, features, causes, symptoms, who the tumors affect, how and where they form, and treatments.
row.field_feature_card_description: Medulloblastoma tumors are fast-growing tumors. They commonly form in the cerebellum. Learn more about medulloblastomas.
row.field_list_description: Medulloblastoma tumors are fast-growing tumors. They commonly form in the cerebellum. Learn more about medulloblastomas.

row.title: Pleomorphic Xanthoastrocytoma (PXA) and Anaplastic Pleomorphic Xanthoastrocytoma (APXA)
row.field_short_title: Pleomorphic Xanthoastrocytoma (PXA) and Anaplastic Pleomorphic Xanthoastrocytoma (APXA)
row.field_page_description: Learn about pleomorphic xanthoastrocytoma (PXA) and anaplastic pleomorphic xanthoastrocytoma (APXA) tumor grades, features, causes, symptoms, who the tumors affect, how and where they form, and treatments.
row.field_feature_card_description: Pleomorphic xanthoastrocytoma (PXA) and anaplastic pleomorphic xanthoastrocytoma (APXA) tumors can be slow- or fast-growing tumors. They occur most often in young adulthood. Learn more about PXAs and APXAs.
row.field_list_description: Pleomorphic xanthoastrocytoma (PXA) and anaplastic pleomorphic xanthoastrocytoma (APXA) tumors can be slow- or fast-growing tumors. They occur most often in young adulthood. Learn more about PXAs and APXAs.
row.field_browser_title: Pleomorphic Xanthoastrocytoma (PXA) and Anaplastic Pleomorphic Xanthoastocytoma (APXA)
row.field_card_title: Pleomorphic Xanthoastrocytoma (PXA) and Anaplastic Pleomorphic Xanthoastrocytoma (APXA)

row.title: Brain and Spine Tumor Anatomy and Functions
row.field_page_description: Learn about your tumor location in the brain or spine to understand your symptoms and what changes you may experience.
row.field_feature_card_description: Learn about your tumor location in the brain or spine to understand your symptoms and what changes you may experience.
row.field_list_description: Learn about your tumor location in the brain or spine to understand your symptoms and what changes you may experience.
row.field_browser_title: Brain and Spine Tumor Anatomy and Functions

row.title: Questions to Ask Your Neuro-oncologist or Neurosurgeon if You Have a Recurrence
row.field_short_title: Questions to Ask if You Have a Recurrence
row.field_page_description: Guiding questions for brain and spine tumor patients to ask their doctor about tumor recurrence or treatments when a tumor comes back.
row.field_feature_card_description: If you have a recurrence, your neuro-oncologist or neurosurgeon can help you determine the best treatment.
row.field_list_description: Questions to ask your neuro-oncologist or neurosurgeon to help you determine the best treatment for you.
row.field_browser_title: Questions to Ask about Recurrence - Rare Brain & Spine Tumor Network
row.field_card_title: Questions to Ask if You Have a Recurrence

row.title: Primitive Neuro-Ectodermal Tumors (PNET)
row.field_page_description: Learn about primitive neuro-ectodermal tumor (PNET) grades, features, causes, symptoms, who the tumors affect, how and where they form, and treatments.
row.field_feature_card_description: Primitive Neuro-Ectodermal Tumors (PNET) are very rare, fast-growing tumors. PNETs is a group of tumors that form in the ectoderm, the outermost layer of cells of an embryo in early development. Learn more about PNETs.
row.field_list_description: Primitive Neuro-Ectodermal Tumors (PNET) are very rare, fast-growing tumors. PNETs is a group of tumors that form in the ectoderm, the outermost layer of cells of an embryo in early development. Learn more about PNETs.
row.field_browser_title: Primitive Neuro-Ectodermal Tumors (PNET)

row.title: Contact Us
row.field_page_description: Contact the organizers of the Rare Brain and Spine Tumor Network.
row.field_list_description: Contact the organizers of the Rare Brain and Spine Tumor Network.
row.field_browser_title: Contact NCI-CONNECT

row.title: Ependymoma
row.field_page_description: Learn about ependymoma grades, features, causes, symptoms, who the tumors affect, how and where they form, and treatments.
row.field_feature_card_description: Ependymoma tumors are more common in the spine than the brain in adults. They often occur near the central canal of the spinal cord and ventricles of the brain. Learn more about ependymomas.
row.field_list_description: Ependymoma tumors are more common in the spine than the brain in adults. They often occur near the central canal of the spinal cord and ventricles of the brain. Learn more about ependymomas.

row.title: Oligodendroglioma
row.field_page_description: Learn about oligodendroglioma and anaplastic oligodendroglioma grades, features, causes, symptoms, who the tumors affect, how and where they form, and treatments.
row.field_feature_card_description: Oligodendroglioma tumors can be slow- or fast-growing tumors. They occur most often in people between the ages of 35 and 44. Learn more about oligodendrogliomas and anaplastic oligodendrogliomas.
row.field_list_description: Oligodendroglioma tumors can be slow- or fast-growing tumors. They occur most often in people between the ages of 35 and 44. Learn more about oligodendrogliomas and anaplastic oligodendrogliomas.

row.title: Coping with a Rare Brain and Spine Tumor Diagnosis
row.field_short_title: Coping with a Rare CNS Tumor Diagnosis
row.field_page_description: Learn positive coping strategies like writing in a journal, relaxation techniques, and asking for support help patients continue to live fully.
row.field_feature_card_description: Learn ways to cope with a rare CNS tumor diagnosis. Positive coping strategies like writing in a journal, relaxation techniques, and asking for support help patients continue to live fully.
row.field_list_description: Learn positive coping strategies like writing in a journal, relaxation techniques, and asking for support help patients continue to live fully.
row.field_browser_title: Coping with a Rare Brain and Spine Tumor Diagnosis
row.field_card_title: Coping with a Rare CNS Tumor Diagnosis
row.meta_keywords: Learn positive coping strategies like writing in a journal, relaxation techniques, and asking for support to help brain and spine tumor patients continue to live fully after diagnosis.

row.field_page_description: Site Map for the Rare Brain and Spine Tumor Network
row.field_browser_title: Rare Brain and Spine Tumor Network Site Map

row.title: NCI-CONNECT Staff
row.field_page_description: The NCI-CONNECT team is dedicated to helping those with rare central nervous system tumors.
row.field_feature_card_description: The NCI-CONNECT team is dedicated to helping those with rare central nervous system tumors.
row.field_list_description: The NCI-CONNECT team is dedicated to helping those with rare central nervous system (CNS) tumors within the NCI Center for Cancer Research Neuro-Oncology Branch (NOB).
row.field_browser_title: NCI-CONNECT Staff
row.field_card_title: The NCI-CONNECT team is dedicated to helping those with rare central nervous system tumors.

row.title: Meetings
row.field_page_description: NCI-CONNECT hosts meetings at NIH throughout the year to bring together worldwide leaders in neuro-oncology to advance knowledge and collaborations.
row.field_feature_card_description: NCI-CONNECT hosts meetings at NIH throughout the year to bring together worldwide leaders in neuro-oncology to advance knowledge and collaborations.
row.field_list_description: NCI-CONNECT hosts meetings at NIH throughout the year to bring together worldwide leaders in neuro-oncology to advance knowledge and collaborations.

row.title: NCI-CONNECT Clinic
row.field_page_description: The NCI-CONNECT Clinic brings together adult patients with the same rare brain or spine tumor and their caregivers to receive special services. Services include a review of your diagnosis, consultations with our healthcare team, coaching from health and wellness counselors, and genetic counseling.
row.field_feature_card_description: The NCI-CONNECT Clinic brings together adult patients with the same rare brain or spine tumor and their caregivers to receive special services.
row.field_list_description: The NCI-CONNECT Clinic brings together adult patients with the same rare brain or spine tumor and their caregivers to receive special services. Services include a review of your diagnosis, consultations with our healthcare team, coaching from health and wellness counselors, and genetic counseling.
row.field_browser_title: NCI-CONNECT Clinic
